title: February 2018 Android Security Bulletin Partner Preview

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In the OMX encoder the length of the buffer is not validated against the length provided by the caller. If the buffer is too small, the encoder could copy uninitialized data into memory that is shared with the caller app.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to remove the vulnerable encoder.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In several places in the mm-video-v4l2 encoder, a buffer is accessed after it is already freed. This could lead to a use after free which could lead to an elevation of privilege in a privileged process.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to add locks to prevent the Use After Free.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In csum_partial_copy_fromiovecend of iovec.c, an offset of zero can be specified even when there are no iovs on the stack, causing an out of bounds read from a kernel stack buffer.  This could lead to information disclosure.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to correctly fail in the case of the empty stack.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: The mdss_rotator_import_buffer() function in mdss_mdp_wfd.c contains unbounded read/write access to a statically sized array.This could lead to escalation of privilege.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to bounds check access to the array.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In libnvomx.so when running in mediaserver, there is a possible out of bounds write.  This could lead to local code execution in a privileged process.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to prevent the out of bounds write.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In msm_isp_prepare_v4l2_buf, the pointer qbuf_buf comes from userspace. qbuf_buf->num_planes is used with no bound check, which if set to a large value will lead to an out of bounds write. It may cause another out of bounds writes in function msm_isp_unprepare_v4l2_buf.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to add boundary checks to the pointer from user space.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In the system credentials screen apps are not prevented from taking screenshots while the user is entering credentials.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to apply FLAG_SECURE to the credentials screen.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In the Bluetooth pairing UI a device name that includes new lines can cause warnings on the pairing dialog to be hidden. This could fool a user into pairing with a malicious device.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to rearrange the warning dialog text to prevent important warnings from being hidden.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In easelcomm_handle_cmd_dma_sg() a negative value can be passed as a length argument, which is then interpreted as an unsigned value, bypassing the size check.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to change the command_arg_len variable to size_t.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: When a clip has I and B slices in a single picture, an infinite loop in ihevcd_ctb_boundary_strength_pbslice could occurs. This could lead to a denial of service of a critical system process.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to update I slices before P/B slices in the same frame.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In blk_mq_tag_to_rq in blk-mq.c, there is a possible use after free due to a race condition when a request has been previously freed by blk_mq_complete_request. This could lead to local escalation of privilege.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to properly track active multi-queue block IO requests and simplify blk_mq_tag_to_rq.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In the MIDI driver global variables in certain ioctl calls are not correctly protected with locks. This could lead to double-free or use-after-free errors in the kernel.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to fix the locking in the affected functions.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In the previous fix a possible deadlock was introduced.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to fix the deadlock.
vulnerabilities.notes: This fix was originally released in the December 2017 partner preview security bulletin.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: XBLRamDump mode is accessible via a key combination at boot time in release builds. This could enable an attacker with physical device access to dump device memory, including on-chip memory used by TrustZone.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to disable the RAM dump functionality.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In fill_this_buffer_proxy in omx_video_base.cpp, there is a possible use after free due to an output buffer being freed prior to its usage. This could lead to local code execution in a privileged process.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to protect the buffer from being freed prior to an access, and apply proper locking.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In libnvmmlite_audio.so when running in mediaserver, there is a possible out of bounds write.  This could lead to local code execution in a privileged process.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to prevent the out of bounds write.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In send_adm_apr of rtac.c, there is an out of bounds read due to a missing bounds check. This could lead to information disclosure.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to add bounds checks.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In __wlan_hdd_cfg80211_txpower_scale_decr_db of wlan_hdd_cfg80211.c, there is an out of bounds read due to a missing bounds check when reading the QCA_WLAN_VENDOR_ATTR_TXPOWER_SCALE_DECR_DB attribute.  This could lead to information disclosure.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to validate the input and perform a bounds check.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: Due to a bad bounds check in ihevcd_parse_headers.c while parsing pic luma samples, an out-of-bounds write can occur. This could lead to remote code execution in a privileged process.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to align width and height to 8.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In qtaguid_ctrl_proc_write in xt_qtaguid.c, there is a possible use after free due to a race condition. This could lead to local escalation of privilege.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to apply proper locking.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: There is an error in certain text field configurations where password data would be considered contextually meaningful, and possibly sent to other apps using a “Share” option. This could cause disclosure of obfuscated passwords.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to disable smart sharing for password entry fields.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In the msm_private_ioctl() function of msm.c, unvalidated user provided data could allow for untrusted pointer dereferences. This could lead to escalation of privilege.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to verify a valid IOCTL before processing user provided data.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In snd_seq_ioctl_create_port in seq_clientmgr.c, there is a possible use after free due to a race condition involving port creation / deletion. This could lead to local escalation of privilege.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to implement proper reference counting / locking.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: Due to a missing check of the shared buffer size before descrambling in descramblerImpl.cpp, an out-of-bounds write can occur. This could lead to an elevation of privilege in a privileged process.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to validate shared buffer size before using.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In DLSParser of eas_mdls.c, there is an error path where dls.wsmpData is not freed, which could lead to a memory leak. This could lead to a denial of service of a critical system process.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to free dls.wsmpData in all return paths to prevent memory leaks.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In the XMF_ReadNode function of sonivox, there is excessive recursion leading to a stack exhaustion and possible memory corruption. This could lead to remote code execution in a privileged process.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to add a recursion limit to prevent the stack exhaustion.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: KeyStoreService::generateKey has a race condition where the pid of the process calling in is checked against an array of allowed pids. However, in between the check and the array population, the process could fork and get a pid that was in the array of allowed pids. This could allow the process to perform privileged actions without being in the privileged process list, resulting in an elevation of privilege.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to check if the pid of the process changed, and error out if it did.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In M3UParser::parse of M3UParser.cpp, if the m3u has a malformed EXT-X-STREAM-INF, a null pointer dereference could occur. This could lead to a denial of service of a critical system process.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to check for null.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In SyntheticPasswordCrypto.decryptBlob() an issue in the decryption order could allow an attacker to bypass rate-limiting when testing passwords.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to correct the order of synthetic password wrapping.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: Due to a missing string null terminal check, when the audio_attributes_t is read from the binder parcel, an out-of-bounds read could occur. This could result in information disclosure that allows a bypass for operating system protections that isolate users or profiles from one another.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to add attribute tags sanitization.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In limEncryptAuthFrame in limSecurityUtils.c, there is a possible stack-based buffer overflow due to overlong AP challenge text. This could lead to remote code execution in a privileged process.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to use an appropriately sized buffer to store challenge text.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In GPU driver code kgsl.c, there is a possible use after free due to a race condition.  This could lead to local escalation of privilege.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to add proper locks to avoid race conditions.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In GPU driver code kgsl.c, there is a possible use after free due to a race condition. This could lead to local escalation of privilege.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to add proper locks to avoid race conditions.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In limProcessAuthFrame in limProcessAuthFrame.c, there is a possible stack-based buffer overflow due to an overlong MAC auth challenge. This could lead to remote code execution in a privileged process.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to dynamically allocate memory so as to properly handle the MAC auth challenge.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: Multiple integer overflow vulnerabilities in the WMA implementation allowed for heap overflows when processing data from the firmware. This could result in an escalation of privilege.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to verify the sizes of data being received from the firmware.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In wma_unified_power_debug_stats_event_handler in wma_features.c, if the value param_buf->num_debug_register received from the firmware is too high, it can lead to an integer overflow in memory allocation. This could lead to escalation of privilege.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to check for the integer overflow condition.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In WLANQCMBR_McProcessMsg in wlan_hdd_ftm.c, there is a possible out of bounds write due to an unvalidated buffer length variable supplied by input.  This could lead to local escalation of privilege.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to validate the buffer length supplied to WLANQCMBR_McProcessMsg.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In wma_roam_synch_event_handler in wma.c, there is an integer overflow in a buffer size calculation leading to a buffer overflow. This could lead to local escalation of privilege.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to properly validate input values received from firmware and used in wma_roam_synch_event_handler.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In wma_unified_link_radio_stats_event_handler in wma_utils.c, there is an integer overflow leading to an out of bounds write. This could lead to local escalation of privilege.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to properly validate input values received from firmware and used in wma_unified_link_radio_stats_event_handler.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In wma_rx_aggr_failure_event_handler in wma_features.c, there is an integer overflow in a buffer size calculation leading to a buffer overflow. This could lead to local elevation of privilege.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to properly validate input values received from firmware and used in wma_rx_aggr_failure_event_handler.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In wma_get_ll_stats_ext_buf in wma_utils.c, there is an integer overflow leading to an insufficient buffer allocation and subsequent out of bounds write on the heap. This could lead to local escalation of privilege.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to properly validate input values received from firmware and used in wma_get_ll_stats_ext_buf.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In spectral_create_samp_msg of wma_features.c and several related functions, there are out of bounds writes due to missing bounds checks when processing some values that come from the firmware. This could lead to escalation of privilege.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to add bounds checks.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In wma_peer_info_event_handler of wma_utils.c, there is an out of bounds write due to an integer overflow, if num_peers is too large. This could lead to escalation of privilege.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to add a bounds check, preventing the integer overflow.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In the  _gpuobj_map_useraddr() function in kgsl.c, the contents of the stack may be leaked due to an uninitialized variable. This uninitialized data could allow for information disclosure.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to initialize the stack variable in all cases.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In q6asm_set_shared_circ_buff of q6asm.c, there is a use after free due to improper locking. This could lead to escalation of privilege.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to fix the locking around this code.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In the msm_isp_ab_ib_update_lpm_mode() function in msm_isp_axi_util.c, an index from an untrusted caller is used without validation. This read out of bounds could allow for information disclosure.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to validate the index.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In msm_ispif_config_stereo of msm_ispif.c, there is an out of bounds write due to a missing parameter check when handling the VIDIOC_MSM_ISPIF_CFG and VIDIOC_MSM_ISPIF_CFG_EXT ioctls. This could lead to escalation of privilege.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to add parameter validation.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In mdss_rotator_release_from_work_distribution of mdss_rotator.c, there is a use after free due to improper locking. This could lead to escalation of privilege.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to fix locking around this code.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In ipa2_query_rt_index of ipa_rt.c and ipa3_query_rt_index of ipa_rt.c, there is a use after free when calling ipa ioctls IPA_IOC_QUERY_RT_TBL_INDEX and IPA_IOC_DEL_RT_RULE, due to improper locking. This could lead to escalation of privilege.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to add locking.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In __ipa_add_hdr_proc_ctx of ipa_hdr.c, there is a use after free when calling ipa ioctl IPA_IOC_ADD_HDR_PROC_CTX and IPA_IOC_DEL_HDR_PROC_CTX due to improper refcount handling. This could lead to escalation of privilege.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to fix the refcount handling.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In rmidev_write of drivers/input/touchscreen/synaptics_dsx_htc/synaptics_dsx_rmi_dev_htc.c, there is an out of bounds write to the kernel stack. This could lead to escalation of privilege.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to remove the affected code. If that is not an option, please reach-out to Qualcomm assistance.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: There is a vulnerability in the AVC encoder where the length of the provided buffer is not validated against the length provided by the caller. If the buffer is too small, the encoder reads extra, uninitialized data.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to correctly check the size of the buffer.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: Due to a missing bounds check while processing  ref_list_reorderin in ih264d_dpb_mgr.c, an out-of-bounds write can occur. This could lead to remote code execution in a privileged process.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to check for out-of-bounds access.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In touch_pmd and touch_pud of mm/huge_memory.c, there is a vulnerability in transparent huge pages where an attacker can manipulate the zero page, presetting the BSS section for new processes.  This could lead to escalation of privilege.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to only mark the page table dirty in touch_pmd and touch_pud if the caller asks for write access.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In the Pixel 2 bootloader, there is an elevation of privilege due to a missing permission check. This could lead to a bypass of carrier restrictions.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to add a permission check.
